doc:doc.doc:summary: A collection of backups that can be made

doc:description.doc:para: Returns a map of opaque backup keys to diplay names.
The display names should be presented to the user, and the keys of those selected by the user should be passed to StartBackup.

doc:doc.doc:summary: The backups that the user wants to make

doc:description.doc:para: An array of opaque backup keys from GetBackupChoices.

doc:doc.doc:summary: The backups which already exist and can be restored

doc:description.doc:para: Returns a map of opaque backup keys to key/value pairs of each backup's properties.
The backup properties include a 'display-name' string, a 'size' in uint64 bytes, and a 'date' time_t as a uint64.
The user interface should present the names/sizes/dates to the user, and the keys of those selected by the user should be passed to StartRestore.

doc:doc.doc:summary: The backups that the user wants to restore

doc:description.doc:para: An array of opaque backup keys from GetRestoreChoices
Provides state information so the user interface can show the progress of backup or restore tasks.

State is a map of opaque backup keys to property maps, which will contain a 'display-name' string and 'action' int whose possible values are queued(0), saving(1), restoring(2), complete(3), stopped(4)

Some property maps may also have an 'item' string and a 'percent-done' double [0..1.0]. For example if these are set to (1, “Photos”, 0.36), the user interface could show “Backing up Photos (36%)”. Clients should gracefully handle missing properties; eg a missing percent-done could instead show “Backing up Photos”.
A failed task's property map may also contain an 'error' string if set by the backup helpers.

doc:doc.doc:summary: Stops the current backup or restore actions.
